MainHeading.P: Chuaigh an Ceann Comhairle i gceannas ar 2.30 p.m.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Comhdháil na nOileán.
MainHeading.P: 1. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Walsh Mr. J. Walsh
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta, ó tharla go bhfuil tábhacht faoi leith ar mhaithe le muintir na n-oileán Gaeltachta san obair atá ar siúl ag Comhdháil na nOileán, an bhfuil sé sásta cuidiú leo ina n-iarrachtaí le feabhas a chur ar shaol sóisialta agus eacnamaíochta na bpobal Gaeltachta ar na hoileáin Ghaeltachta.

Speaker.hpid: Aire Stáit ag an Roinn Oideachais agus ag an Roinn Saothair (Mr. Kenny) Aire Stáit ag an Roinn Oideachais agus ag an Roinn Saothair (Mr. Kenny)
Speaker.NameTxt: Aire Stáit ag an Roinn Oideachais agus ag an Roinn Saothair (Mr. Kenny)
Speaker.P: Bíonn mo Roinnse i dlúth-theagmháil rialta le pobail na n-oileán Gaeltachta, go háirithe trí na comharchumainn atá ag feidhmiú ar a mbunáite, agus táim sásta gurb é sin an bealach is fearr chun fadhbanna a aithint agus teacht ar shlite lena réiteach. Bíonn tairbhe na scéimeanna éagsúla atá á reachtáil ag mo Roinnse agus ag Údarás na Gaeltachta ar fáil ar na hoileáin Ghaeltachta agus bíonn cabhair níos airde ná an gnáthráta deontais iníoctha sna hoileáin sin faoi Achtanna na dTithe (Gaeltacht) agus faoi scéimeanna áirithe de chuid mo Roinne.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Ar Chuir Comhdháil na nOileán cogar ar aghaidh le gairid chuig an Rialtas ó fhochoiste Chomhdháil na nOileán faoi chóras farantóireachta d'Árann? Tuigim gur cuireadh é sin ar aghaidh. An bhfuil sé ag teacht os comhair an Rialtais go fóill nó ar iarradh ar Aire na Gaeltachta aon chinneadh a dhéanamh ina leith sula dtiocfadh sé chuig an Rialtas?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Níl an t-eolas sin agam faoin tuarascáil a bhfuil an Teachta ag caint fuithi. Ach gheobhaidh mé an t-eolas sin dí.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: An aontódh an tAire Stáit gur cúrsaí farantóireachta na cúrsaí eacnamaíochta is tábhachtaí do phobal Gaeltachta na nOileán ar fud an chósta? Agus is ionadh liom, ó tharla go bhfuil ceist anseo faoi chúrsaí eacnamaíochta, nach mbeadh eolas ag an Aire Stáit os a chomhair amach faoi choiste farantóireachta nó faoi chóras ceart farantóireachta a chur ar fáil do na hoiléain tri chéile.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tá a fhios agam go bhfuil an t-ábhar sin an-tábhachtach, ach ní hí sin an cheist a cuireadh chuig an Roinn anseo, ach mar a dúirt mé, gheobhaidh mé an t-eolas agus cuirfidh mé scéal chuig an Teachta.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Cultúrlann Ghaelach.
MainHeading.P: 2. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta cén cúnamh atá ar fáil ón Roinn do phobal nach bhfuil sa Ghaeltacht, agus atá ag iarraidh úsáid na Gaeilge a leathnú agus cultúrlann Ghaelach a bhunú.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: D'fhonn an Ghaeilge agus an cultúr a chur ar aghaidh ar fud na tíre tugann mo Roinnse deontais bhliantúla do Bhord na Gaeilge agus d'eagrais áirithe Ghaeilge agus chultúir agus fágtar fúthu san socruithe a dhéanamh chun freastal ar phobail ar leith.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: An gceapfadh an tAire go mbeadh sé níos fearr socruithe faoi leith a chur i bhfeidhm i gcomhair pobal cosúil le pobal Bhaile Munna atá ag iarraidh pobal Gaelach a bhunú sa cheantar. B'fhéidir go mbeadh sé níos fearr deontais faoi leith a thabhairt ón Roinn go dtí pobail mar iad seachas trí Bhord na Gaeilge.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tugadh níos mó ná milliún punt do Bhord na Gaeilge i mbliana agus tá scéimeanna faoi leith á reachtáil ag an mBord chun cabhrú le coistí Gaeilge i scoileanna agus i gColáistí Oideachais agus mar sin. Freisin, tugadh £1,150,000 do na heagrais Ghaeilge ón Roinn i mbliana freisin. Agus déanann siad san sárobair chun an Ghaeilge a leathnú ar fud na tíre.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: An bhfuil a fhios ag an Aire an méid airgid a chaitear as an deontas taobh amuigh den Gaeltacht?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tá sé fite fuaite taobh istigh den Ghaeltacht agus taobh amuigh. Mar shampla fuair Gael Linn i mbliana £315,000; fuair Comhdháil Naisiúnta na Gaeilge £240,000 agus fuair Conradh na Gaeilge níos mó ná £100,000 i mbliana. Mar adúirt mé tá níos mó ná milliún punt caite ag na heagrais sin agus caitear cuid den airgead sin taobh amuigh den Ghaeltacht.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: An cheist agam ná an bhfuil a fhios ag an Aire cé mhéad den airgead a chaitear leis na heagraisí seo taobh amuigh den Ghaeltacht, abair chun cultúrlann a bhunú taobh amuigh den Ghaeltacht mar measaim go bhfuil an chuid is mó den airgead seo á chaitheamh istigh sa Ghaeltacht. Sílim go gcaithfear a thuilleadh de a chaitheamh taobh amuigh de.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Níl an t-eolas cruinn sin agam, a Theachta, ach anuas ar an méid a tugadh dóibh siúd d'íoc an Roinn £155,000 do Chomhaltas Ceoltóirí Éireann agus £28,000 do Siamsa Tíre agus ní chaitear iomlán an airgid sin taobh istigh den Ghaeltacht. Ach níl an freagra díreach ar do cheist anseo agam. Is dóigh liom go gcaitear cuid mhaith den airgead sin lasmuigh den Ghaeltacht.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Lyons Mr. Lyons
Speaker.P: Ní mór dom fiafraí den Aire Stáit faoin cheist seo de bharr go bhfuil méadú tagaithe ar na Gaelscoileanna tríd na tíre seo, an bhfuil sé ar intinn ag an Aire nó ag an Roinn i leith na ceiste atá luaite, is é sin ceist a dó ansin, rud éigin a dhéanamh chun tacaíocht a thabhairt do na tuismitheóirí agus do na leanaí agus iad uile atá ag freastal ar na Gaelscoileanna? Nach bhfuil sé soiléir don Aire nó doibh siúd atá ag obair san Roinn gur cóir freastal ar na daoine seo? An gcreideann sé go bhfuil sé soiléir anois go bhfuil leathnú ag teacht ar an nGaeilge de bharr na nGaelscoileanna seo agus an bhfuil sé ar intinn ag an Aire agus ag an Roinn cúnamh a thabhairt do na daoine san? Sin an cheist atá ann. Nílim ag caint faoi na heagraíochtaí anois. Luaigh tú Conradh na Gaeilge agus iad siúd. Nílim ag caint futhu siúd. Táim ag caint faoi na tuismitheóirí agus na clainn atá ag bunú na nGaelscoileanna seo.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Aontáim leis an Teachta go bhfuil níos mó brú le déanaí ná mar a bhí le fada an lá chun Gaelscoileanna nua a chur ar bun ar fud na tíre. Tá ceist, sílim, ag an Teachta O'Rourke faoi na naionraí Gaeilge níos fuide síos ar an liosta agus tabharfaidh mé an t-eolas duit ag an am sin más maith leis an Teachta ach tá fhios aige freisin go dtugann Bord na Gaelge cabhair do na naionraí lán-Ghaeilge tríd an Comhchoiste Réamhscolaíochta agus tugann sé sin cabhair airgid chun an Ghaeilge a leathnú agus a neartú ar fud na tíre.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Kerry Gaeltacht Extension.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Gaeltacht the plans he has to extend the Kerry Gaeltacht areas; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Níl a leithéid beartaithe.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Naí Scoileanna Ghaeltachta.
MainHeading.P: 4. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. O'Rourke Mrs. O'Rourke
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta céard é polasaí Roinn na Gaeltachta maidir le cuidiú dearfa a thabhairt do naí scoileanna ar fud na Gaeltachta.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Is é Údarás na Gaeltachta a thugann cúnamh do naíonraí sa Ghaeltacht agus tuígim uathu go mbítear sásta breithniú báúil a dhéanamh ar iarratas ó aon choiste tuismitheoirí sa Ghaeltacht a bhfuil fonn air naíonra lánGhaelach a bhunú.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An n-aontódh an tAire go bhfuil gá le cuid mhaith cuidiú a thabhairt do naíscoileanna agus go bhfuil tábhacht faoi leith ag baint leo maidir le múineadh na Gaeilge a chur chun cinn? An n-aontódh sé go bhfuil easpa airgid ar an Údarás agus nach dtig leo an oiread is ba mhaith leo a dhéanamh maidir leis na cúrsaí seo a chur chun cinn?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tá a fhios ag an Teachta Gallagher go bhfuil cúnamh á fháil ag 49 naíonraí faoi láthair agus nuair a bhíonn an tÚdarás sásta leis an gcóiríocht, le fiúntas an chláir oibre agus le stiúrthóir an naíonra bíonn tacaíocht le fáil acu; agus iarratas a bheith istigh acu chuig an Údarás déaneann siad breithniú báúil air ón taobh sin de.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Ó tharla go bhfuil na milliúin punt nó ainm is na milliúin punt caite ag an Aire Stáit seo ina Dháilcheantar féin nó geallta aige le roinn seachtainí anuas ó thaobh leathnú ar scoileanna agus scoileanna nua agus mar sin de, an bhféadfadh sé a insint dúinn cé mhéid naíscoil nua atá ceadaithe i gContae Mhaigh Eo agus cé mhéad naíscoil atá ann faoi láthair ag obair?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Sílim nár ceadaíodh aon naíscoil nua i gContae Mhaigh Eo.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Go fóill.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Le déanaí nó go fóill. Níl a fhios agam céard faoi atá an Teachta ag caint ansin.

MainHeading.RHead: Answers. - IDA agus Údarás na Gaeltachta
MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - IDA agus Údarás na Gaeltachta.
MainHeading.P: 5. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta ar tharla aon chomhráití leis an IDA maidir le hairgead a aistriú chuig Údarás na Gaeltachta agus an dtabharfaidh sé ráiteas fá dtaobh de.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Bhí iarrachtaí leanúnacha ar bhonn leathan ar siúl le tamall anuas maidir le caipiteal vótáilte breise d'Údarás na Gaeltachta i mbliana agus ghlac an Dáil le Meastachán Forlíontach ar 4 Nollaig faoina mbeidh caipiteal vótáilte breise de £2,205,000 ar fáil don eagraíocht sin i 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Lyons Mr. Lyons
Speaker.P: I dtaca leis an cheist seo b'fheidir nach raibh a fhios aige nó b'fhéidir go bhfuil a fhios ag an Aire seo gur chuir mé ceist chuig a chara, an tAire Tionscail agus Tráchtála an tseachtain seo caite mar gheall ar Roinn na Gaeltachta agus dúirt sé gur ceist do Aire na Gaeltachta é. Táim anois ag fiafraigh den Aire Stáit an aontaíonn sé liom go bhfuil 900 postanna ar fáil sna Gaeltachtaí ach nach bhfuil an t-airgead ag an Údarás chun na postanna sin a chur chun cinn. An bhfuil eolas faoi ag an Aire Stáit?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tá an cheist ag iarraidh eolais faoí airgead a aistriú ó Roinn eile go dtí Roinn na Gaeltachta. Táim ag rá gur ghlac an Dáil le déanaí le Meastachán Forlínteach chun £2 milliún eile a chur ar fáil don Roinn i mbliana.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Lyons Mr. Lyons
Speaker.P: Cad a cheapann an tAire faoin cheist a bhí agam an tseachtain seo caite? Níl aon duine ón IDA ar bhord an Údaráis. An gceapann an tAire gur fearr go mbeadh duine ón IDA ar bhord an Údaráis ionas go bhféadfaidís tionscail a chur ar aghaidh sna Gaeltachtaí? Nach droch an rud é nach bhfuil duine dá leithéid ar an Údarás? Bhíodh duine mar sin ann.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Níl a fhios agam an bhfuil an Teachta ag rá nach oiriúnach na daoine atá ag freastal ar bhord an Údaráis faoi láthair. Sílim go bhfuil anbhaint acu le comharchumainn ar fud na tíre. Sin cinneadh an Rialtais agus tá sé ann le fada an lá.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Feicim an Teachta McGinley ag gáire ansin.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An n-aontódh an tAire go bhfuil sé amaideach go mbeadh an tÚdarás fágtha gan airgead i gcaitheamh na bliana seo le postanna a chur ar fáil agus san am céanna nach raibh an t-airgead a bhí ag an IDA á chaitheamh. Agus an n-aontódh sé go mbeadh sé ciallmhar go bhféadfaí scair den airgead sin atá ag an IDA nó a bhí ag an IDA i gcaitheamh na bliana seo a thabhairt don Údarás le postanna a chur chun cinn, rud nár tharla.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Fiafraíonn an cheist seo ón Teachta Gallagher an raibh comhráití ar siúl faoi aistriú airgid ó Roinn amháin go dtí Údarás na Gaeltachta agus séard atá mé ag rá gur ghlac an Dáil Meastachán Forlíontach, agus bhí níos mó £2 mhilliún le fáil i mbliana.

MainHeading.RHead: - Deisiú Bóthair in nDún na nGall
MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Deisiú Bóthair in nDún na nGall.
MainHeading.P: 6. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an eol dó an drochbhail atá ar bhóthar Mín na Craoibhe, Anagaire, Contae Dhún na nGall a ndearnadh dmáiste dó le linn d'Údarás na Gaeltachta a bheith ag tógáil monarchan ann agus an gcuirfidh sé deontas ar fáil le é a dheisiú láithreach.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Déanfar an cás a luann an Teachta a scrúdú chomh luath agus is féidir.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Nuair a dhéanann comhlacht príobháideach damáiste do bhóthar bíonn teacht aniar ag an gcomhairle chontae ar an gcomhlacht príobáideach sin. Nár chóir go mbeadh an teacht aniar céanna acu ar chomhlacht Stáit nuair is comhlacht Stáit a dhéanann an damáiste?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Is deacair rud éigin a dhéanamh faoi seo agus tá iarrtha ar stiúrthóir áitiúil na Roinne an cás seo a phlé. Tháinig achainí isteach ó Theachtaí Dhún na nGall le déanaí faoi agus aontaím leat go gcaithfear rud éigin a dhéanamh faoi, ach níl an t-eolas go hiomlán sa Roinn faoi láthair. Tá sé á scrúdú.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. McGinley Mr. McGinley
Speaker.P: Ba mhaith liom a rá go raibh mé féin ar an bhóthar i gcaitheamh na seachtaine agus go bhfuil eolas pearsanta agam air. Tá a lán daoine ina gcónaí ann. Tá sé i bhfíor-dhrochstaid agus, ba mhaith liom go ndéanfaí rud éigin gan mhoill, ní i gceann bliana ach gan mhoill, mar tá sé i ndroch-chaoi ar fad.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Bunscoileanna Lán-Ghaeilge.
MainHeading.P: 7. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Mitchell Mr. G. Mitchell
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an mbíonn teagmháil idir a Roinn agus an Roinn Oideachais i dtaca le forbairt a dhéanamh ar an líon bunscoileanna lán-Ghaeilge i mbailte móra agus i bpríomhchathracha na tíre.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Ní bhíonn baint díreach ag mo Roinnse le scoileanna a bhunú nó a fhorbairt — is ceist í sin a bhaineann go príomha leis an Roinn Oideachais. Tugann Bord na Gaeilge — eagras Stáit faoi choimirce mo Roinnese — cúnamh airgid bliantúil do Ghaelscoileanna, eagras a thugann comhairle agus tacaíocht do phobial a bhíonn ag iarraidh scoileanna lán-Ghaeilge a bhunú nó a fhorbairt.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Mitchell Mr. G. Mitchell
Speaker.P: An n-aontódh an tAire Stáit go bhfuil tacaíocht níos mó don Ghaeilge agus a húsáid í measc tuismitheoirí, agus go rachadh comhoibriú idir an dá Roinn chun socair do cheist na teanga, go speisialta i gcathracha na tíre?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Aontaím leis an Teachta go bhfuil níos mó úsáid á baint as an nGaeilge agus go bhfuil an-bhá don Ghaeilge ar fúd na tíre. Breathnóidh mé ar an rud adúirt sé. Ach aontaím leat go bhfuil níos mó úsáid á bhaint as thart ar fuaid na tíre i gcoitinne.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Lyons Mr. Lyons
Speaker.P: Ceist ghairid, an-tábhachtach faoi na Gaelscoileanna atá luaite sa cheist seo, agus tá na príomhcathracha luaite chomh maith. Ní mór dom ceist a chúr ar an Aire Stáit cén sórt teagmhála atá déanta aige nó atá á déanamh ag a Roinn leis an Roinn Oideachais chun scoil Mahon agus scoil Parklands i gCorcaigh a bhunú nó cead a thabhairt na scoileanna sin a chur ar bun. An bhfuil teagmháil á dhéanamh nó an gcreideann an tAire go bhfuil sé in am teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an Roinn Oideachais chun na scoileanna sin a bhunú?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Bhí neart díospóireachta taobh istigh den Roinn Oideachais faoi na scoileanna a luaigh an Teachta agus má chuireann sé ceist anseo sa Dáil tabharfaidh mé freagra iomlán dó.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Bord Údarás na Gaeltachta.
MainHeading.P: 8. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an míneoidh sé don Dáil ó tharla Bord Údarás na Gaeltachta a bheith anois ceaptha ina iomlán cén fáth ar thóg sé chomh fada leis an obair seo a chur i gcrích.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Bhí sé chomhalta ainmnithe ar Bhord Udarás na Gaeltachta le ceapadh agamsa le héifeacht ó 1 Iúil 1986 agus fógraíodh ar 2 Iúil go raibh cúigear ceaptha le héfeacht ó 1 lúil 1986. Fógraíodh ar 10 Meán Fómhair 1986 go raibh an séú comhalta ceaptha le héifeacht ón lá céanna. Idir an dá linn is amhlaidh go raibh breithniú á dhéanamh agam ar an gceist.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Fostaíocht i nGaeltacht Chorcaigh.
MainHeading.P: 9. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Moynihan Mr. D. Moynihan
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta ó tharla go bhfuil tús le bánú na Gaeltachta i gCorcaigh arís, de bharr easpa postanna agus obair a chur ar fáil do dhaoine óga nach bhfuil i ndán dóibh ach an imirce, an inseoidh sé céard atá á dhéanamh aige féin agus ag Údarás na Gaeltachta leis an scéal a leigheas.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tuigim ó Údarás na Gaeltachta go mbíonn gach dícheall á dhéanamh acu chun tionscail oiriúnacha a aimsiú a chuirfidh deiseanna fostaíochta breise ar fáil i nGaeltacht Chorcaí.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Lyons Mr. Lyons
Speaker.P: An aontódh an tAire liom go bhfuil díomá tagaithe air an leathnú sin atá i gceist aige chun an tionsclaíocht oiriúnch a bhunú faoi mar a dúras cheana — go bhfuil easpa airgid ann? Tá na postanna sin le fáil ach níl an t-airgead ag Bord Údarás na Gaeltachta chun na postanna a chur ar fáil.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Bhí a ndóthain airgid sa tír seo leis na blianta anuas ach i 1985 bhí níos mó ná 284 ag obair taobh istigh de Ghaeltacht Chorcaí agus, ó 1982 ní raibh ach 274 ag obair ann. Agus ceadaíodh tograí le déanaí a chuirfidh breis fostaíochta ar siúl as seo amach, taobh istigh de limistéar na Gaeltachta. Tá eolas ag an Teachta faoi sin.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Feabhsú Chéibh.
MainHeading.P: 10. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geogheagan-Quinn Mrs. Geogheagan-Quinn
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta cé na pleananna atá aige chun feabhsúcháin riachtanacha a thionscnamh ar Chéibh Inis Oírr. Oileáin Árann.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tá mo Roinnse i gcomhairle le hOifig na nOibreacha Poiblí agus leis an gcomharchumann ar an oileán maidir le socruithe a bheadh oiriúnach chun báid a tharraingt aníos as an uisce ag an áit sin. Thairis sin níl aon oibreacha feabhsúcháin breise beartaithe ag mo Roinnse don áit ag an bpointe seo.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: An n-aontódh an tAire Stáit go bhfuil drochbhail ar an gcé agus go bhfaca roinnt againn é le déanaí, gurb é an t-aon chóras leanúnach farantóireachta atá ag an oileán faoi láthair agus i ndrochaimsir go bhfuil deacrachtaí faoi leith ag an mbád. Chun gur féidir é sin, b'fhéidir, a fheabhsú ar bhealach amháin nó ar bhealach eile tá feabhsúcháin riachtanacha ag teastáil faoi láthair, agus an mbeadh an tAire Stáit sásta iarraidh ar Oifig na nOibreacha Poiblí deifriú lena bhfiosrúchán fad is a bhaineann sé leis an scéal?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Déanfaidh mé, cinnte. Tá a fhios ag an Teachta, go raibh crann tógála soghluaiste á lorg ag bainisteoir an chomharchumainn agus go raibh Oifig na nOibreacha Poiblí ag rá go mbeadh sé oiriúnach crann tocrais nó “which” a chur ar fáil ansin. Tá an díospóireacht sin ar siúl fós. Beidh me ag plé an scéil go práinneach le muintir Oifig na nOibeacha Poiblí.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Bheinn buíoch dá ndéanfadh an tAire Stáit é sin mar fhad is atá an díospóireacht sin ag dul ar aghaidh idir Oifig na nOibreacha Poiblí agus Roinn na Gaeltachta, is iad muintir na n-oilean atá thiar leis.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Úsáid na Gaeilge.
MainHeading.P: 11. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Mitchell Mr. G. Mitchell
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta cé na pleananna atá aige chun Teachtaí agus Seanadóirí a spreagadh le níos mó Gaeilge a úsáid, ag cur san áireamh go bhféadfaidh a leithéid dul i gcion go mór ar an líon mór daoine a mbionn baint ag Teachtaí Dála agus Seanadóirí leo.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Aontaím leis an Teachta go bhféadfadh dea-shampla ó Theachtaí Dála agus ó Sheanadóirí cur go mór le cur chun cinn na Gaeilge i measc an phobail i gcoitinne. Chuige sin mhol mé tairiscintí don dá Theach sa bhliain 1984 go mbunófaí Coiste Oireachtais d'fhonn athbhreithniú agus moltaí a dhéanamh ó am go ham i dtaobh: (a) úsáid na Gaeilge a leathadh in imeachtaí na Dála agus an tSeanaid agus i dtimpeallacht an dá Theach, agus (b) cur chun cinn na Gaeilge i gcoitinne.

MainHeading.P: Tháinig an comhchoiste le chéile don chéad uair ar 29 Bealtaine 1985 agus chuir siad tuarascáil le moltaí bunúsacha insroichte ar fáil i mí Iúil 1985 maidir le leathadh na Gaeilge i dTithe an Oireachtais agus i dtimpeallacht na dTithe. Chuir an Comhchoiste tuarascáil chuimsitheach faoin ábhar céanna ar fáil i mí Aibreáin 1986 agus is cúis áthais dom go bhfuil cuid, ar a laghad, de na moltaí praiticiúla sa tuarascáil sin á feidhmiú faoi láthair.

Tá súil agam go leanfar leis an obair sin agus go dtabharfaidh gach Comhalta den dá Theach oiread tacaíochta agus is féidir d'iarrachtaí an chomhchoiste chun an Ghaeilge a chur chun cinn sa dá Theach agus lasmuigh díobh.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Mitchell Mr. G. Mitchell
Speaker.P: An mbeadh an tAire Stáit sásta dianchúrsa cónaithe Gaeilge sa Ghaeltacht a shocrú do Theachtaí Dála agus do Sheanadóirí sa chaoi go mbeadh an chuid againn atá ar bheagán Gaeilge ábalta úsáid a bhaint as an teanga ag cruinnithe poiblí agus mar sin de — cabhrú le húsáid na teanga i gcoitinne?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tá a fhios ag an Teachta go bhfuil gach uile Theachta agus gach uile Sheanadóir an-bháúil don Ghaeilge taobh istigh de Thithe an Oireachtais. Is dóigh liom gur féidir a rá go raibh gach Teachta agus Seanadóir ar scoil ag foghlaim Gaeilge le cúpla bliain. Freisin, ag éirí as moltaí an chomhchoiste, tá téipthaifeadáin agus téipeanna curtha ar fáil taobh istigh den Teach. Sílim freisin go mbíonn cuid de na Teachtaí ar saoire sna ceantair Ghaeltachta atá ar fud na tíre, ach breathnóidh mé ar an moladh atá déanta ag an Teachta.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Beidh toghchán ann an bhliain seo chugainn. B'fhéidir go bhféadfaimís socrú ar an taobh seo den Teach go dtógfadh an Teachta Mitchell cúrsa cónaithe lena chuid Gaeilge a fheabhsú i rith na dtrí seachtainí a bheas an toghchán ar siúl.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Lyons Mr. Lyons
Speaker.P: An n-aontóidh an tAire liom go bhfuil an iomad cainte déanta agus á dhéanamh mar gheall ar an nGaeilge agus gan an iomad á dhéanamh as Gaeilge? Cén socrú nó cad a cheapann an tAire go bhféadfaimís a dhéanamh chun athrú a chur ar an scéal? An iomad cainte mar gheall ar an nGaeilge, gan ach beagán cainte as Gaeilge.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kenny Mr. Kenny
Speaker.P: Tá a fhios ag na Teachtaí gur Cathaoirleach ar an gcoiste é an Teachta Gallagher agus tá an-pháirt aige leis an gcoiste. Tá a fhios acu go bhfuil moltaí a cuireadh ar bun ón tuarascáil sin á gcur i gcrích taobh istigh den Teach faoi láthair. Tá comharthaí dhátheangacha crochta ar fud na dTithe. Sílim go bhfuil an t-atmaisféar níos fábharaí don Ghaeilge. Tá iarrachtaí suntasacha ar siúl ag an bhfoireann, go háirithe san oifig fáilte, chun an Ghaeilge a chur chun cinn agus mar sin de.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Bass Stocks.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. B. Ahern Mr. B. Ahern
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the efforts he is making to conserve bass stocks; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Kavanagh) Liam Kavanagh
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Kavanagh)
Speaker.P: Following a recent decision of a Council of Fisheries Ministers, a minimum landing size of 32 centimetres for bass will apply from 1 January next. This should significantly help in conserving the bass stocks around our coasts. I am also considering whether additional conservation measures are necessary but I am not in a position at present to comment pending completion of this examination.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister will be aware that there is widespread concern about bass stocks. Are there any proposals in his own Department to introduce prohibitions in areas where the stocks are badly threatened?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: At the recent meeting where I raised the problem of the bass stocks around our coast we agreed the minimum size of 32 centimetres which should be beneficial to conserving the stocks. I am considering other measures but, since they have not been formulated yet, I would prefer not to go too deeply into the question in that direction at this stage. I can assure the Deputy that, in the light of what he and others have said in the House, that there is a need to ensure that this stock is conserved. I am also aware that recent fishing has had adverse effects on the stock level of a particularly slow growing species.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - County Cork Commonage.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Creed Mr. Creed
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the present position in relation to the Moulnahorna commonage, a portion of which has been taken over by his Department; and if he intends to pursue the matter further and acquire the full area involved.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: It has not been possible so far to reach agreement with all the shareholders in the commonage lands at Moulnahorna, County Cork, with a view to acquiring the lands for afforestation. It is the intention of my Department, however, to renew their efforts in the near future to reach such agreement.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Dutch Elm Disease.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Haughey Mr. Haughey
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the progress, if any, which has been made in controlling the epidemic of Dutch Elm disease in Ireland; if the new method of biological control is being used here; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: While no significant progress has yet been achieved in the control of Dutch Elm disease, my Department continue to be actively involved in research on the disease. The Forest and Wildlife Service of the Department is co-operating with the chemistry department of University College, Dublin, in an EC project involving chemical analysis of the pathogen. Regular contact is also maintained with researchers in Holland who are investigating the use of a systemic fungicide as a means of controlling the disease. The Forest and Wildlife Service is also represented on a panel of EC experts which meets regularly to monitor developments.

In the long term the selection and breeding of resistant strains is considered to be the most satisfactory solution to the disease. This remedy is, however, by its nature a slow one but scientists are confident that a resistant strain of elm can be developed. In this connection the EC has sponsored an international tree-breeding programme in which the Forest and Wildlife Service is participating as part of a general research programme into Dutch Elm disease. Selected strains of elm have been outplanted at the John F. Kennedy Park and their growth is being monitored.

The Forest and Wildlife Service has also carried out a series of experiments using the new biological method of control involving the use of a fungus. The results of these experiments are currently being evaluated.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Can the Minister give me any indication of the expenditure in his Department and the number of personnel involved in this area? The Minister must surely be concerned that, in spite of all the research work that has been done to date, Dutch Elm disease is almost out of control and some greater effort will be needed by his Department if the situation is to be brought back under control again.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: Regarding the amount of expenditure and personnel in my Department involved here, I have not got that information as it was not required of me in the question. We must accept that, in the long term, the selection and breeding of resistant strains of elm is considered the most satisfactory solution to the disease. That is as a result of various investigations that have taken place both here and abroad. Although various fungicides have been tried the disease by its nature, has proved to be resistant to most of the present controls that have been tried. Indeed, until some systemic fungicide has been found, either here or abroad, the method I have suggested is probably the only one at the moment. A new developing systemic fungicide is under investigation in Holland and there are some hopeful signs that it may be an answer to the disease, but at this stage there are no specific results. Scientists believe that in the long term the only solution to the problem is breeding a resistant strain of elm. The news may not be very encouraging but this is as a result of study over long periods.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Are officials in the Department using the new strains which have been identified? Is there a system of inoculation being organised by the Department? What action is being taken in that respect?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The treatments that are being tried and tested abroad are being watched by researchers at my Department and if something is brought forward by way of a fungicide that can be used to inoculate these trees then undoubtedly that will be used. It can only be used, obviously, on an individual basis rather than by way of spraying a stand of timber. If this is found to be effective, then we will certainly use it. At this time I have to say that the treatment that has been tried on this species of trees — we have planted some out in John F. Kennedy Park in Wexford — is being monitored as to its results on these trees.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Gweedore (Donegal) Deer.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he will give details of the proposed deer management plans at Gweedore Forests 1 and 2, if he will meet with representatives of local concerned groups before taking a policy decision; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: My Department are now completing their examination of available options for the management of deer on certain State forest properties in the Gweedore area of County Donegal. I feel that no useful purpose would be served by my having discussions with local interests at this stage but I suggest that they should submit their views on the matter to my Department so that they can be fully considered before final decisions are reached.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. McGinley Mr. McGinley
Speaker.P: I am glad to hear there have been no final decisions taken as yet. If it is proposed to depart from standard practices of entrusting management to local communities, would the Minister be willing to meet a deputation of the very active and responsible Donegal Deer Society, that is, if he intends departing from traditional or accepted management practices?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: As the Deputy knows, there are divided opinions on this topic in the Donegal area, including the Donegal Deer Society and other individual deer-hunters. As I said in my reply, if their views are submitted to my Department it may mean I would be in a position to consider meeting a deputation in the future.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Lough Sheelin Fish Catches.

Speaker.hpid: Dr. O'Hanlon Dr. O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he is satisfied that there has been no reduction in the level of fish catches in Lough Sheelin in 1986; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: There has been no serious reduction in the number of fish caught in Lough Sheelin in 1986. The level of reported catches fluctuates from year to year. According to anglers' returns, the number of fish caught in the years 1984, 1985 and 1986 were 1,299, 1,538 and 1,123 respectively.

Speaker.hpid: Dr. O'Hanlon Dr. O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: Is the Minister aware of the concern among anglers at the deterioration in the condition of the lake which was admitted by the Minister of State at the Department of the Environment? Will the Minister say whether his Department have any role to play in the prevention or control of pollution in Lough Sheelin?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I am aware there has been a certain amount of concern expressed about Lough Sheelin and the fish catches there but I have to say that the figures I have just given indicate there has not been a great fluctuation between the years 1984 and 1986. There was an increase in 1985. The earlier part of this year showed encouraging results but the latter part has not been quite so encouraging. As the Deputy knows, primary responsibility for water pollution control rests with local authorities under the provisions of the Local Government (Water Pollution) Act, 1977. In the case of Lough Sheelin that control rests with Cavan County Council who, as the Deputy may be aware, have two representatives, one of whom is the chairman of the Lough Sheelin management committee, and who have issued section 12 notices to various individuals.

Speaker.hpid: Dr. O'Hanlon Dr. O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: Will the Minister say whether his Department have any role to play in the prevention of pollution?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The Deputy must be aware that the fisheries boards have control in their functional areas. The Department have no control in that respect; any control is carried out by the fisheries boards of the various areas.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Forestry Employment.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. S. Byrne Mr. S. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he has any proposals to re-employ the forestry workers recently laid off in State forests and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Brennan Mr. P. Brennan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the action he proposes to take to increase employment in State forests in Wicklow; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 20 and 45 together.

My Department employ a number of temporary workers each year to assist with seasonal operations or to meet peak demands in other work. The termination of these workers' employment arises either from the completion of the work on which they were engaged or when the funds available for their employment is running out.

My Department have always employed temporary workers for these reasons and I expect that they will continue to do so for the foreseeable future. As temporary employment becomes available in the future these workers will be considered for re-employment. Deputies will be pleased to know that of those let go recently it has been possible to offer further temporary employment to 28 workers.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Kowloon Bridge Disaster Consequences.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the precautions which have been taken to prevent the contamination of fish stocks arising from the grounding of the Kowloon Bridge off Cork; if he is taking any measures to ensure that the image and reputation of Irish fish and fish products do not suffer as a result of international publicity on the grounding of the ship; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Browne Mr. J. Browne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he has taken action to protect herring spawning grounds from the oil slick from the Kowloon Bridge; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he is aware of the widespread anxiety in the south-west regarding the threat to sea birds and nature habitats in coastal areas from the oil slicks from the Kowloon Bridge; the efforts he is making to control and monitor the situation; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Walsh Mr. J. Walsh
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he is aware of the danger to fishing beds off the south west coast resulting from oil leakage from the Kowloon Bridge; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the action he proposes to take to protect spawning fish, fish farms and marine life generally from the oil slicks at present threatening the south west coast from the Kowloon Bridge; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if any action has been taken by him to minimise the risk to marine life, fishing activities, fish stocks, sea birds, unique nature reserves and habitats in the south west coast area arising from oil seepage from the Kowloon Bridge; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 21, 26, 30, 39, 54 and priority Question No. 59 together.
I am fully aware of the threat posed by the wreck of the Kowloon Bridge and I share local concern in the matter.

My Department are co-operating fully with the operations group to ensure that damage to fisheries, wildlife and habitats in the area is prevented or curtailed to the minimum. Specially constructed protective booms have been put in place across the entrance to the Lough Hyne Marine Nature Reserve. Wildlife staff are patrolling beaches along the southern coast to locate and treat any wild birds found to be contaminated by oil.

Members of my Department's staff and officials of the South Western Regional Fisheries Board are also monitoring the situation and advising on the protection of fisheries. My Department have taken samples of fish and oil for analysis.

MainHeading.P: There is only one oyster grower in the immediate vicinity and he has taken remedial action to protect his stock.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: Has there been any indication to date of the extent of damage to fish stocks or indeed to the coastal areas concerned? Can the Minister also indicate what specific action — other than having wildlife staff patrolling beaches — his Department are taking to prevent this?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I can tell the Deputy that there is a slick of oil coming from the submerged tanker of approximately 30 meters wide, flowing due east, which is visible for about three or four miles. My Department, the Department of the Environment — which is the leading Department dealing with oil slicks — the Department of Communications and the local authorities in the area are involved in this whole operation. They are monitoring the situation between Roches Point and Youghal and between Lough Hyne and Rosscarbery. I can inform the Deputy that 270 dead birds have been found by Departmental staff and they are mostly guillemots. In addition, approximately 120 lightly-oiled birds have been observed. These are gulls, oyster catchers and rain plover. Reports received from other concerned groups suggest that about 30 other birds have been killed by oil. With regard to the Deputy's other supplementary question about fish, I can tell him that only today as I was leaving my Department I met our official from the area. He is satisfied that the fish life in the area is not being affected to any great degree. Continual monitoring will be maintained in the area to ensure that the position does not deteriorate.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister must be aware that the whole episode of the Kowloon Bridge and the way it has been handled by the Minister involved leaves a lot to be desired. The Minister must be aware also that we very nearly had a major catastrophe in the whole south west area and the prevention of such a catastrophe was due more to good luck rather than any action taken by the Minister or his Department. Can the Minister give us some indication now of how the situation will be dealt with because there is widespread anxiety that major damage will be done not only to stocks but to existing mariculture projects and other marine life there? Is he aware furthermore that people are not satisfied that his Department, who have responsibility there, are prepared adequately to deal with that situation?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I cannot agree with the Deputy that there has been any degree of slackness or laxity shown by any of the Departments responsible. As he will be aware, the leading Department with regard to the application of controls in this area is the Department of the Environment. The Department concerned with both ships involved in the area is the Department of Communications. I can tell the Deputy also that as soon as the problem arose officials from all Departments were despatched to that area and operations commenced. Great credit is due to everybody involved that the damage that resulted was contained to one ship so far and has been to a very limited degree. The actions subsequently taken have been all that could have been taken by any Department operating as they did so effectively and quickly after the accident. The fact of two major catastrophes happening in the area — the Kowloon Bridge and the Capo Emma events — at the same time created a problem for members of the staffs of both Departments and the local authority but immediately it happened and by 7.30 a.m. on 24 November, control centres were set up in both Skibbereen and Bantry to deal with the risks from the two ships. The priority areas in the vicinity of the Stags Rock including Lough Hyne, were identified and immediate arrangements made to protect some of them by using booms. It was also necessary to concentrate on protection of shore and clean up measures, as fuel oil from the Kowloon Bridge did not respond to dispersement.

MainHeading.P: The Deputy is wrong in saying that there was any mismanagement; the opposite was the case. There was a great deal of activity to ensure that the danger to animal life, fish life and the tourist areas around the southern coast was minimised.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister is well aware that if adequate action had been taken this matter need never have arisen. If a detention order had been served on the Kowloon Bridge she need never have left the vicinity. However, that is a separate issue. How many personnel from the Minister's Department were involved in this area and were specialist people available to advise what action should be taken, for instance, for the protection of wild birds and fish stocks there?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I assure the Deputy that, first, the Department to which he referred originally in his supplementary question should have been the Department of Communications. I am satisfied that the action they took was the proper action in the circumstances. Second, as regards my Department, again I assure him that the operations group who were set up in 1984 as the result of another problem on the Irish Sea represent all those Departments. These are the Departments of the Environment, Communications, Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry and Defence as well as the local authorities, Waterford County Council. Cork County Council, members from the Dublin Port and Docks Board and the Department of Energy. My Department's officials are involved as are members of the Southern Regional Fisheries Board and the South-Western Regional Fisheries Board as required.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Holiday Accommodation Grants.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Foley Mr. Foley
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the total grant paid to Bord Fáilte in 1985 for the development of holiday accommodation (grants-in-aid); the expenditure compared with the grant allocated; and, if it is under expended, the reason.

Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan)

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - River Tolka Pollution.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. T. Leonard Mr. T. Leonard
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he will make a statement on the damage to fish life, wild birds, etc. from recent pollution on the River Tolka; and the action which will be taken in this matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: Fish stocks in that part of the River Tolka affected by the recent pollution incident are low but the Eastern Regional Fisheries Board are investigating the matter to see if a prosecution is warranted.

In so far as the damage to wildbirds is concerned, I would like to acknowledge the swift and effective action which was taken by Dublin County Council, the Irish Wildbird Conservancy and the Dublin Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals. Fifty-two mute swans were removed from the river, all covered in light fuel oil. Seven have since died, three were fit for release and the remainder are receiving treatment.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Timber Exports.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. McEllistrim Mr. McEllistrim
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the reason timber is being exported via Caherciveen, County Kerry, and not processed here in Ireland.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: According to the information available to me the firm who are exporting pulpwood size timber from Caherciveen regard it as more commercially attractive to do so than to sell it at prevailing market prices to alternative domestic outlets. There are no restrictions on such exports to other member states of the European Community.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Regional Fisheries Boards Managers' Remuneration.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Browne Mr. Browne

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - County Wicklow Lake.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if his Department carried out any survey on the condition of the dam at Paddock Lake in County Wicklow, prior or subsequent to it being taken over by the Forestry and Wildlife Service; the results of any such survey; if there was any indication that repairs were required; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: There is no record in the Department relating to the condition of the dam prior to the acquisition, in 1954, or of the land on which it is situated. The dam was, however, thoroughly inspected by the Department's engineer as recently as 1981 and found to be structurally sound. Prior to that, and up to the time of its collapse, it had been inspected from time to time in the course of the normal management of the surrounding forest land and there was no indication that any repairs were necessary.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: The Minister says that a survey was carried out in 1981. Has any maintenance been carried out to the dam since then and, if so, can he outline the nature of that maintenance?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: As I said, the Department's engineer carried out the survey in 1981 in connection with improvements carried out by the Forestry and Wildlife Service to a road which runs over the dam. During that survey, the dam was inspected and found to be completely sound. Prior to 1981 and since then, routine inspections of the dam have been carried out by the local forest management and no structural faults were detected.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: Despite the fact that no structural faults were found, was any maintenance whatsoever carried out on the dam since 1981 regardless of the structural conditions?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: As I said, when the forestry officials carried out their inspection their inspectors obviously would have looked for structural faults and if some had been found, they would have been repaird but since there were none there was no need for any work to be carried out on the dam.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: Do I take it that the answer is that no maintenance was carried out on the dam?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I said there were no structural faults in the dam.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: No maintenance?

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Mariculture-Aquaculture Projects.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the arrangements he is making for the designation of areas for maricultureaquaculture projects; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The designation of areas within which it shall be lawful to engage in aquaculture subject to licence is covered under section 54 of the Fisheries Act, 1980.

In early 1986, a special unit was set up within my Department to deal specifically with aquaculture matters. Since the setting up of this section, 13 areas have been considered for designation. This brings the total number of such areas to 22. Eleven areas have now been designated. Eight of these cover extensive areas of the Galway and Mayo coastal regions which are the major centres of aquaculture interest. The making of these designation orders will facilitate the early consideration of applications for aquaculture licences within the areas covered by the order.

Of the remaining eleven areas, I have decided not to designate one area near Rogerstown, County Dublin and am considering the reports of the other relevant inquiries to see what parts, if any, of the areas in question can now be designated.
In addition, I am drawing up a further list of areas where designation procedures can commence.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Can the Minister tell me the number of licences that have been held up pending designation?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: That did not form part the question and I would not like to give information of which I am not certain. I could forward the Deputy that information later.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Would the Minister agree that the number of applications for licences is in the region of 400 and that as a result of the delay in designation this development has been held up over the past number of months?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I cannot confirm that the number is 400 but I will confirm that to the Deputy as soon as I return to my office. I regard it as of the utmost importance that the designated areas be examined closely before licences are granted and that every facility be given to all parties interested in agriculture and to all those concerned about its development to have their voices heard before the designated areas are decided. The Deputy will be aware that I have designated most of the areas in the west, in Galway, Mayo and so on, and the Deputy must be aware of a statement which I released yesterday regarding these designations.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: When the Minister said “most areas in the west” did he take into account an area around the Aran Islands about which there has been some speculation recently? Will the Minister say what consultations have taken place with local interests?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The eight orders designated recently were, Carna, Clifden and four other areas, Carlingford Lough, County Louth, Mulroy Bay, County Donegal, Clew Bay, County Mayo, Ventry Harbour, Trabeg Bay, County Kerry. The Aran Islands' area is not included in any of those designations so representations from any quarter can be made in that respect.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: We will now move on to questions nominated for priority.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Fishing Fleet.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he has any proposals to halt the rapid deterioration of the fishing fleet; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I do not accept that there is, or has been, a rapid deterioration in the fishing fleet. There is, in fact, a continuing programme of fleet modernisation being carried on with the aid of BIM and FEOGA assistance.

Furthermore, An Bord Iascaigh Mhara are, at my request currenly reviewing their marine credit plan with a view to making the best use of the available State funds for (i) modernisation of the fleet, (ii) the introduction of a certain number of new vessels in each category and (iii) obtaining the maximum benefit from the proposed new EC structures regulation.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister will be aware that we need considerable investment to modernise the fleet and to bring in new vessels. Can the Minister indicate if there will be a greater uptake in demand for new vessels and modernisation under the new structures policy than under the last one because the amount of aid got from the Community under the last programme was the second lowest of any member state? A very small allocation was obtained to replace and modernise the fleet compared with what was received by other member states.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The Deputy is right in seeing a greater hope for expansion of the fleet under the new structures document which has lessened in some cases the amount of local contribution and increased the amount of the FEOGA grants. In that respect there could be a greater takeup. In other respects, along with modernising the fleet the limits imposed by the EC have been improved as a result of our discussions of 3 December. If the Deputy has not already seen the full details of the result of the structures discussions he will be reasonably happy with the outcome with regard to our fishing industry.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Nobody could be happy with the provision which we got from the last policy structures document and proposals. The Minister will be fully aware that the aid which we received is very low and that nothing has been done in the past four years to modernise the fleet or to get new vessels. Can the Minister give some indication that we will do better now, having regard to the complications in the new structures policy, than we did over the past three or four years? Will there be a new Government plan to help to modernise the fleet?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: A number of measures are being taken in the Department. The fleet will be modernised with State funds. I regard that as a priority. With more money from FEOGA this should now be possible. The big problem is to provide the amount of money which we need to provide to meet our share of the FEOGA grant available. The changes we have achieved in the structures programme will mean that our contribution may be somewhat smaller for a given amount of work that can be done in the future.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: A final question.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister must be aware that it is really the lack of State investment which is hampering the development of the fleet. The FEOGA money cannot be claimed because the State is not providing its contribution. Under the new regulations it will be more difficult because the State will now have to pay 10 per cent rather than 5 per cent. How can the Minister square that, having regard to the fact that we have done so badly up to now?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The Deputy did not listen to what I said in the original reply. I am to review the marine credit plan so as to make the best available use of the State funds.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Is the Minister providing the necessary funding, that is the question?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: That can be done too. We are in the course of Estimates discussions but the better use of the money available is something which must be investigated at the moment.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - Tourism Revenue.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if, given that total overseas tourism revenue in 1986 is estimated to be down 6 per cent on 1985, with a decline of 4 per cent in total visitor numbers, he considers that this poses a very serious problem for the industry; and if he will make a statement on his plans to deal with the crisis in the sector.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan) Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan)
Speaker.P: While the figures quoted by the Deputy are correct, I do not accept that there is a crisis in the sector. As the House is aware, the overall decline in overseas visitor numbers and revenue in 1986 is due to exceptional factors outside our control which seriously restricted the level of North American traffic to Europe. These factors resulted in a 20 per cent decline in visitor numbers to Ireland from the North American market but notwithstanding our overall tourism performance was up on 1984 which was itself a good year.

MainHeading.P: The 1987 promotional and marketing campaign will seek not only to recover the ground lost in the North American market this year but to achieve real growth in all our main markets. The campaign will focus on exploiting the recent favourable developments in relation to access transport services. In particular a major sales drive involving Bord Fáilte, the carriers and the various other sectors of the industry will be launched next February in the British market to ensure that the attraction of Ireland and the new lower air and sea fares are fully promoted.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: Would the Minister agree that apart from the exceptional factors which arose this year in the tourism industry, that it was a disappointing year?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: In so far as the major drop in the American market was concerned, it was minimised to an extent due to a very early joint Bord Fáilte-industrial promotion drive to America. While we regret the drop in the American trade, we have fared much better than our other European competitors in this regard.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: I am pleased to hear the Minister confirm that the tourism industry is in the doldrums. The Minister said he would have a marketing initiative next year. Do I take it that the Minister is confirming now that the £3 million extra marketing revenue being sought by Bord Fáilte will be made available in next year's Estimate?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: As the budgetary figures are currenly under examination I am not in a position to indicate to the Deputy the provision for tourism.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: Will the Minister indicate how he proposes funding the marketing initiative he referred to in his first reply?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: Because of the importance of the tourism industry and the importance the Government attach to it, I am quite confident that in the budgetary discussions full regard will be given to the importance of the promotional marketing sector of Bord Fáilte and its costs.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: I ask one final supplementary?

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: There are two more questions to be dealt with.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: Let me ask one on this question. The Minister uses the White Paper on Tourism as the major motivator for the industry. Will the Minister tell us if the interdepartmental policy co-ordinating committee which he set up to develop co-operation between Government agencies met and how many times have they met? Can we expect any recommendations from them in the immediate future?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: As the nature of the Deputy's supplementary was not contained in the original question I am not in receipt of the details but I will say the interdepartmental committee are meeting monthly.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna — Questions. Oral Answers. - White Paper on Tourism.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry given the importance attached by the White Paper on Tourism to the environment as a tourism asset, if he will state the level of progress to date on moves towards environmental management and the preservation and development of amenities; in this context, if he is concerned at the threats of pollution to the vital tourism industry of the south west; and if he will make a statement on his plans to protect tourism in the south west from this menace.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: There has been considerable progress on the implementation of the environmental initiatives mentioned in the White Paper on Tourism. While my Department do not have primary responsibility in relation to environmental matters, they liaise very closely with other Departments and Bord Fáilte on relevant issues in view of the vital importance of the environment to tourism.

MainHeading.P: The Deputy will be aware that in the White Paper the Government directed that other Departments and agencies should take full account of tourism needs and interests in their programmes. Through the interdepartmental committee on tourism, my Department are ensuring that there is the maximum coordination in relation to environmental matters as they affect tourism.

I am, of course, very concerned about any threat to the environment from pollution. In relation to recent incidents off the south west coast to which I assume the Deputy is referring, I am satisfied that my colleagues, the Ministers for the Environment and Communications, have as far as is possible taken all the necessary measures to protect the environment. My Department are of course actively involved at local level in co-operating with the other agencies and, where necessary, taking action in relation to specific tourism, fisheries and wildlife interests.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: The Minister's White Paper on Tourism asked Bord Fáilte to embark on a more active approach in encouraging development and preservation of the environment. Will the Minister indicate to the House precisely what measures Bord Fáilte have taken to satisfy the demand the Minister put on them? Can the Minister give us a few examples?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: The White Paper on Tourism contained a number of initiatives on the environment. The following matters are those which were to be implemented by Bord Fáilte. Firstly, the agreement of a pilot area with the City and County Managers' Association which will be a model for a project on litter bin design, provision and servicing. This project has now been completed. Dún Laoghaire was designated as the pilot area and it is hoped that local authorities around the country will adopt the proposals of the pilot study. Secondly, the computerised mapping of the country's physical attractions. This has been implemented by Bord Fáilte. Thirdly, the carrying out of a study of our national heritage of outstanding landscapes to identify those areas of tourist importance which may be under threat from development. A Bord Fáilte study on the Connemara landscape is currently in draft form. It is intended that similar detailed assessments of other key landscapes will take place, subject to an agreement with the county councils. Fourthly, the production of a policy document on water pollution and its implications for tourism. Bord Fáilte have employed a consultant to examine this issue and a report is expected during 1987. Fifthly, the intensification of Bord Fáilte co-operation with the planning authorities. In 1986, Bord Fáilte made a detailed submission to local authorities who were reviewing their country development plans. Similar submissions will be made to local authorities reviewing their plans in 1987.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: Now you know.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: Apart from a few consultants which have been appointed, the only progress which has been made is a new litter bin design.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The Deputy must not have been listening.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: Finally, can I ask the Minister——

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: The Deputy has excluded his colleague, Deputy Gallagher.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: Under the White Paper on Tourism, it was suggested that the special employment schemes might provide employment for people in improving tourism amenities. Will the Minister indicate how many people have been employed under the social employment schemes to develop tourist amenities during the year?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: That is a separate question involving a detailed examination of all the different areas and I am in no position to give that information.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: It is a question on the implementation of the Minister's White Paper on Tourism. Is the Minister aware that there is a White Paper on Tourism?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: I am, indeed.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: This is an integral part of it.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: All local authorities are co-operating up to the fullest in the development of tourist amenities under the social employment schemes.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: Can the Minister tell us a few of the amenities they have developed?

MainHeading.Title: Private Notice Questions. - Cross-Border Incursions.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Haughey Mr. Haughey
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Foreign Affairs if, in view of the deep anxiety in Border areas and widespread public resentment at the growing number of incursions by the British security forces into the territory of this State, he will make a statement on what action he has taken in relation to the latest incidents and what measures the Government are taking to bring them to an end.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Foreign Affairs (Mr. P. Barry) Peter Barry
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Foreign Affairs (Mr. P. Barry)
Speaker.P: I have taken the opportunity of yesterday's meeting of the Anglo-Irish Conference to have a very frank and very useful discussion with the Northern Ireland Secretary of State, Mr. King, about incursions by members of the Northern security forces. I made clear that the Government view all incursions with the most serious concern and I sought action on the British side to ensure against recurrence.

Mr. King regretted the incursions which had taken place. He confirmed that all soldiers serving in Northern Ireland are given clear instructions that incursions are not permitted and that the greatest care should be taken to avoid even accidental crossings of the Border. Mr. King assured me that special briefings are given to regiments when they arrive and that regular reminders are issued.

MainHeading.P: In the light of recent incursions, the standing instructions to soldiers will be re-emphasised. It has also been agreed that urgent discussions will take place in the Secretariat to discuss what further action can be taken to avoid incursions in the future.

Incursions are simply not acceptable, but let me add that we need to bear in mind the background of these incursions, namely, the campaign of murder and destruction in the Border area and the difficulty for the Northern security forces of patrolling a frequently unclear Border under constant threat of death.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Haughey Mr. Haughey
Speaker.P: I am glad to note that the Minister raised the matter at the meeting yesterday. I know the Minister would agree with me that there is all the difference in the world between inadvertent strayings across the Border by, perhaps, newly arrived soldiers or inexperienced troops. Is the Minister satisfied, however, that that was the case in this instance? Is he aware in relation to the incursion near Glassdrummond that the British Army Press Office described it as a “hot pursuit” military operation? Would the Minister care to indicate what information he has about that aspect for the benefit of the House?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Barry Mr. P. Barry
Speaker.P: There were a series of explosions from a mortar-type weapon on the afternoon in question. There was an effort made to apprehend people — this is, so far, an unconfirmed report I have — who drove away in two cars. It appears the soldier in question was not fully aware of the precise place where the Border was and he was apprehended under a citizen's arrest by two members of a family on the farm where he was on at that moment who turned him over to the Garda Síochána. They, in turn, took him to Dundalk where the Director of Public Prosecutions directed that a file should be prepared and the soldier in question should be released if an assurance was given if he would appear again, if necessary, at a trial. Beyond that I have no further details. It certainly was not, as far as I know, a hot pursuit in the sense of a deliberate crossing of the Border to proved otherwise during any trial.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Haughey Mr. Haughey
Speaker.P: Could the Minister confirm that the standing practice in this regard is still being adhered to, namely that the contact in cross-Border security operations is between police force and police force? There seems to be some indication that in this incident there was communication between the British Army and the Garda. It is an important point and I should be grateful if the Minister would indicate that the former practice is still being followed through. I wish to ask also about the new military observation posts which have been placed by the British authorities very close to the Border. Is the Minister aware that these are causing a great deal of anger and disquiet on both sides of the Border, especially among small farmers on the northern side of the Border who have been very rudely and arrogantly displaced? Is he aware also that the implications of these observation posts for people on our side of the Border are somewhat intimidatory? Can the Minister give any information or reassurance about these new posts and say whether he or the Government or the Garda were aware of their establishment and the purposes of them?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Barry Mr. P. Barry
Speaker.P: I can confirm that the practice of communication between the security forces is RUC to Garda. Regarding the second point about the observation posts in south Armagh, I met a deputation of small farmers from that area who were brought to see me by the Deputy Leader of the SDLP, Mr. Séamus Mallon, and they strongly expressed to me their concern about these posts. That concern was conveyed to the British Government through the secretariat established under the Anglo-Irish Agreement. On the Deputy's third question, I had no prior notice of the erection of these posts.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Haughey Mr. Haughey
Speaker.P: Does the Minister agree that while cross-Border co-operation in security matters is important, it is equally important that incursions by British military personnel across the Border should be totally prevented in so far as possible? All those who would favour cross-Border security co-operations would nevertheless have grievous doubts about incursions by British military personnel into the territory of the State and there are widespread feelings of resentment and animosity about such incursions. Whereas in the normal course of events it is difficult to prevent accidental strayings across, the general public here would like to be fully assured that any incursions in future would be restricted to such accidental crossings.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Barry Mr. P. Barry
Speaker.P: They should never be otherwise than accidental. I said yesterday and previously and repeated in my reply today that incursions are simply not acceptable. That is the Government's view. I understand, of course, that there are occasions when they take place in error. The Secretary of State expressed his regret for the incursion that had taken place and undertook to reconfirm instructions given to troops in Northern Ireland about the necessity strictly to observe the Border.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kirk Mr. Kirk
Speaker.P: Could I ask the Minister for Foreign Affairs to confirm that the three British soldiers who crossed the Border and attempted to break and enter the house in question assaulted the individual who executed a citizen's arrest on the soldier in the farmyard before gardaí arrived?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Barry Mr. P. Barry
Speaker.P: I cannot either confirm or deny. My information is that only one soldier came across the Border and that he was handed over to the Garda. There may be a case pending, as the Director of Public Prosecutions decides.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kirk Mr. Kirk
Speaker.P: Will the Minister confirm to the House that the soldiers in question will be prosecuted for the offence?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Barry Mr. P. Barry
Speaker.P: It is not a matter for me. It is a matter for the Director of Public Prosecutions.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Calleary Mr. Calleary

MainHeading.Title: Single European Act — Neutrality and Protocol No. 30: Motion.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: Items Nos. 9 and 20 will be debated with item No. 8. A separate decision will be taken on each item.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Foreign Affairs (Mr. P. Barry) Peter Barry
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Foreign Affairs (Mr. P. Barry)
Speaker.P: I move:

That Dáil Éireann reaffirms Ireland's position of neutrality outside military alliances, and notes with satisfaction that the provisions in Title III of the Single Europe Act relating to the co-operation of the High Contracting Parties (that is, the Twelve member States of the European Community) on the political and economic aspects of security and the closer co-ordination of their positions in this area do not affect Ireland's position of neutrality outside military alliances.

MainHeading.P: That Dáil Éireann further notes and welcomes the provisions of Article 23 of the Single European Act on Economic and Social Cohesion, which enhances and strengthens the commitment of the Community to the achievement of the objectives set out in Protocol No. 30 on Ireland appended to the Treaty of Accession of Denmark. Ireland and the United Kingdom to the European Communities.
The debate on this motion is being taken in conjunction with motion No. 9 approving the terms of the Single European Act and with the Second Stage of the European Communities (Amendment) Bill, 1986.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: Order, please. We are commencing an important debate and I would ask the Deputies, if they wish to leave the House, to do so quietly.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Barry Mr. P. Barry
Speaker.P: The Bill has two operative sections. Section 1 will make certain provisions of the Single Act part of domestic law. These provisions are those which amend the existing European Community Treaties which are already part of domestic law. Because of the provision of the Single Act which permits the European Parliament to be formally described as the Parliament rather than the Assembly, section 2 of the Bill provides that references to the Assembly of the European Communities in any earlier Act or statutory instrument shall be construed as references to the European Parliament.

The provisions of Title III of the Single Act, which deal with European Co-operation in the Sphere of Foreign Policy, do not amend the Community Treaties and do not, therefore, require to be made part of domestic law.

MainHeading.P: I have placed a motion before the Dáil in order to permit the Dáil to reaffirm Ireland's position of neutrality outside military alliances and to note with satisfaction that the provisions of Title III of the Single Act relating to the co-operation of the Twelve on the political and economic aspects of security and the closer co-ordination of their positions in this area do not affect our position of neutrality outside military alliances. Furthermore, the motion will give the Dáil an opportunity to note and welcome the provisions of the Single Act on Economic and Social Cohesion which enhance and strengthen the commitment of the Community to the achievement of the objectives of Protocol 30 on Ireland appended to the Treaty of Accession.

The Single European Act as a whole, including the foreign policy provisions, will involve charges on public funds and it is for this reason that I have placed before the Dáil the second motion to approve the terms of the Single Act.

The debate today is of great importance for our membership of the Community, and for our place and role in its further development. Therefore, in considering in this debate the Single European Act, which represents the opening of the way towards the further development of the Community, it would, I think, be opportune and desirable to make some assessment of our experience of membership to date.
